item.title: 欧洲央行行长霍尔茨曼称通胀粘性被低估普尔索
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员罗伯特-霍尔兹曼（Robert Holzmann）在接受智利《LT Pulso》杂志采访时警告说，人们对通货膨胀的顽固性估计不足。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Robert Holzmann warned that inflation’s tenacity is being miscalculated, according to an interview with Chile’s LT Pulso.】

item.title: 法院批准亿万富翁阿加瓦尔开采赞比亚矿山的计划
item.description: 韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd.）可以收回对赞比亚孔科拉（Konkola）铜矿项目的控制权，因为法院批准了一项清偿该矿债权人债务的计划。【原文：Vedanta Resources Ltd. can take back control of the Konkola copper project in Zambia after a court sanctioned a plan to settle debts owed to the mine’s creditors.】

item.title: 马克龙进入大选对决，勒庞看似难以击败
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙号召法国人民 "书写历史 "的号召将在周日成为现实，届时选民将前往投票站参加第一轮立法选举。【原文：Emmanuel Macron’s rallying call to the French people to “write history” will become a reality on Sunday when voters head to polling stations for the first round of legislative elections.】

item.title: 毛里塔尼亚将成为天然气生产国，领导人寻求连任
item.description: 毛里塔尼亚现任总统很可能在周六举行的选举中获得连任，这将为投资者提供一个保证，确保这个即将成为天然气生产国的欧盟盟国的政策连续性。【原文：Mauritania’s incumbent president is likely to secure a second term in elections on Saturday, providing investors with an assurance of policy continuity in a European Union ally that’s on the cusp of becoming a gas producer.】

item.title: 把握英国大选的股票交易指南
item.description: 随着反对党工党准备上台执政，住宅建筑商、能源公司和一家拥有 500 年历史的邮政公司成为受英国 7 月 4 日大选结果影响最大的股票。【原文：Homebuilders, energy companies and a 500-year-old postal firm are among the stocks most exposed to the outcome of Britain’s July 4 election as the opposition Labour Party prepares to take power.】

item.title: 德里机场灾难引发对莫迪建筑狂潮的担忧
item.description: 在印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）斥资数十亿美元改善全国交通状况之际，印度最繁忙的机场发生了致命的屋顶坍塌事故，这是该国近期一连串基础设施灾难中的最新一起，引发了安全问题。【原文：The deadly roof collapse at India’s busiest airport is the latest in a string of recent infrastructure disasters in the country, raising safety questions as Prime Minister Narendra Modi spends billions of dollars to improve transportation across the country.】

item.title: 越南经济增长因贸易和外国直接投资而超出预期
item.description: 受贸易复苏和外商投资推动商业活动增加的影响，越南第二季度的经济增速超过预期。【原文：Vietnam’s economy accelerated more than forecast in the second quarter, buoyed by a recovery in trade and increased business activity aided by foreign investment.】

item.title: 澳大利亚总理称傲慢的 Meta 应为新闻付费
item.description: 澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴内塞（Anthony Albanese）称社交媒体公司傲慢且不负责任，因为政府要求 Meta Platforms Inc.【原文：Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese called social media companies arrogant and irresponsible, as the government’s battle to have Meta Platforms Inc. continue to pay local media organizations for content escalated.】

item.title: 机器人开始从事亚洲最脏的农活之一
item.description: 在马来西亚一个潮湿的早晨，一架无人机在树丛间嗡嗡作响，监测油棕果的成熟情况。自动驾驶卡车在广阔种植园凹凸不平的地面上隆隆驶过，铺设肥料，拾起密密麻麻的收获果穗。【原文：A drone buzzes between trees on a humid Malaysian morning, monitoring the oil palm fruits as they ripen. Self-driving trucks rumble over the vast plantation’s uneven ground, laying fertilizer and picking up the densely packed harvested bunches.】

item.title: 战争疲劳来袭，俄罗斯商品流入新加坡
item.description: 两年多前，俄罗斯入侵乌克兰后，许多国家和公司都回避与俄罗斯做生意，但俄罗斯制造的商品，从发制品到巧克力，却在新加坡的虚拟超市货架上大打折扣。【原文：Heavily discounted Russian-made goods, from hair products to chocolate, are finding their way onto Singapore’s virtual supermarket shelves even as many countries — and companies — shun doing business with the nation following its invasion of Ukraine more than two years ago.】

item.title: 英国能源公司反对为新客户提供更低价优惠的计划
item.description: 英国能源供应商和消费者保护组织正敦促监管机构维持在能源危机期间为帮助稳定市场而出台的禁止向新客户提供更便宜电价的规定。【原文：UK energy suppliers and consumer-protection groups are urging the regulator to maintain a ban on cheaper tariffs for new customers that was introduced during the energy crisis to help stabilize the market.】

item.title: 米莱改变阿根廷计划第二阶段的政策
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱（Javier Milei）的政府周五开始实施其所谓的第二阶段经济计划，宣布将把中央银行持有的纸币换成新的国债，目前政府仍在与私人银行谈判新国债的条款。【原文：Argentine President Javier Milei’s administration embarked on what it called the second phase of its economic plan Friday by announcing that it will swap out notes held at the central bank for new Treasury debt that it’s still negotiating the terms of with private banks.】

item.title: 贝莱德宣布在封闭式基金与萨巴基金的斗争中获胜
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）宣布在与 Boaz Weinstein 的 Saba Capital Management 长达数月的代理权争夺战中取得胜利，称五只封闭式基金（总金额达 80 亿美元）的持有人拒绝了激进分子要求终止该公司投资顾问资格的努力。【原文：BlackRock Inc. declared victory in its months-long proxy battle with Boaz Weinstein’s Saba Capital Management, saying holders of five closed-end funds with a combined $8 billion rejected the activist’s effort to terminate the firm as investment adviser.】

item.title: 高盛对冲基金主管称是时候削减投资组合风险了
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：After a blistering rally driven by the biggest technology stocks pushing the S&P 500 to a string of all-time highs this year, it’s “a good time to tap the brakes,” according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Tony Pasquariello.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织批准在债务重组协议后向加纳支付 3.6 亿美元
item.description: 在加纳与官方债权人达成债务重组协议后，国际货币基金组织同意立即向加纳支付 3.6 亿美元。【原文：The International Monetary Fund agreed to immediately disburse $360 million to Ghana, after the country reached a debt restructuring agreement with its official creditors.】

item.title: Bicara Therapeutics 选择摩根士丹利进行首次公开募股，金额高达 1.5 亿美元
item.description: Bicara Therapeutics 公司正与摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）合作进行美国首次公开募股，熟悉情况的人士说，因为首次股票销售市场正显示出正常化的迹象。【原文：Bicara Therapeutics is working with Morgan Stanley on a US initial public offering, people familiar with the situation said, as the market for first-time share sales is showing signs of normalizing.】

item.title: KKR 投资的金融云公司 OneStream 公开申请 IPO
item.description: KKR & Co.支持的软件公司OneStream Inc.公开提交了首次公开募股申请，披露了收入增长和亏损减少的情况。【原文：KKR & Co.-backed software company OneStream Inc. has filed publicly for an initial public offering, disclosing growing revenue and shrinking losses.】

item.title: Vista支持的汽车数据公司Solera公开申请在美国上市
item.description: Vista Equity Partners 支持的汽车数据和软件服务提供商 Solera Corp. 已公开申请在美国首次公开发行股票，因为首次公开发行股票的市场在进入夏季后几乎没有放缓的迹象。【原文：Vista Equity Partners-backed automotive data and software services provider Solera Corp. has filed publicly for a US initial public offering, as the market for first-time share sales shows little sign of slowing into the summer.】

item.title: 全球锂供应过剩，阿根廷即将掀起锂浪潮
item.description: 尽管有大量资金投入阿根廷的巨型锂矿，但近十年来，阿根廷仅有一个新矿投产。这种情况即将改变。【原文：For all the money that’s poured into Argentina’s giant lithium deposits, the country has seen just one new mine come on stream in almost a decade. That’s about to change.】

item.title: 美国最大银行在美联储压力测试后提高派息
item.description: 在本周早些时候轻松通过美联储的年度压力测试后，美国最大的银行周五轮番宣布提高对投资者的派息。【原文：The biggest US banks took turns announcing higher payouts to investors Friday after easily passing the Federal Reserve’s annual stress test earlier this week.】

item.title: 2024 年市场丰收期的经济裂缝正在暴露
item.description: 本周，就在全球最大的股票市场结束了又一个辉煌的季度后，新的备忘录股票狂热成为华尔街的焦点。【原文：Fresh meme-stock mania took center stage on Wall Street this week just as the world’s biggest equity market closed out another blistering quarter.】

item.title: 咆哮的凯蒂猫 "达到巅峰？狗狗推特集会展示了它的力量和极限
item.description: 本周，咆哮的凯蒂猫（Roaring Kitty）在社交媒体上的最新轻浮行为让交易员们疯狂地阅读一幅以狗为主角的漫画。【原文：The latest social-media frivolity this week from the man known as Roaring Kitty sent traders frantically reading into a cartoon featuring, of all things, a dog.】

item.title: 散户交易者在美股期权中的地位空前提高
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：Non-professional investors now make up a bigger part of the US options market than ever, pouring money especially into short-term bets and favoring technology stocks, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：分散也是信贷市场的一个故事
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 美国大选余波刺激监狱股和石油股；大麻和可再生能源股表现落后
item.description: 在备受瞩目的乔-拜登总统与前总统唐纳德-特朗普的总统辩论结束后，多个行业的股票交易商正在重新安排仓位。【原文：Equities traders across multiple sectors are rearranging their positions in the aftermath of the much-anticipated presidential debate between President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织认为乌克兰经济增长放缓，债券持有人谈判 "愈演愈烈
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）下调了乌克兰的经济增长预期，因为俄罗斯对乌克兰电力基础设施的打击拖累了该国的经济。【原文：The International Monetary Fund cut its growth forecast for Ukraine, as Russian strikes on its power infrastructure drag on the nation’s economy, and said talks with bondholders are “intensifying” as a repayment deadline nears.】

item.title: Alvean 和 Raizen 在大型交易所交割中获得白糖
item.description: 大宗商品贸易商 Alvean Sugar SL 和巴西最大的生产商 Raizen SA 将大部分原糖用于交割即将到期的纽约期货，这是多年来这一时期最大的一次交割。【原文：Commodities trader Alvean Sugar SL and top Brazilian producer Raizen SA took most of the raw sugar to settle expiring New York futures in the largest delivery for this time of year in years.】

item.title: 西班牙 Europastry 公司以法国大选为由搁置 IPO 计划
item.description: 西班牙烘焙公司 Europastry SA 推迟了首次公开募股，成为在该地区首次公开募股复苏乏力的情况下，最新一家停止上市计划的欧洲公司。【原文：Spanish bakery firm Europastry SA postponed its initial public offering, becoming the latest European firm to halt listing plans amid the region’s faltering IPO revival.】

item.title: Rite Aid 避免全面关闭，重组计划获批
item.description: Rite Aid 公司的重组计划获得法院批准后，已获准退出破产程序，该计划准备通过将业务控制权交给主要债权人，使这家濒临破产的连锁药店免于清算。【原文：Rite Aid Corp. has been cleared to exit bankruptcy after winning court approval on a restructuring plan that’s poised to save the ailing pharmacy chain from liquidation by handing control of the business to key creditors.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚中央银行无视石油价格，将利率降至 11.25
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行周五将基准利率下调半个百分点至 11.25%，顶住了政府要求其加快货币宽松步伐以重振经济增长的压力。【原文：Colombia’s central bank cut its benchmark interest by half a percentage point to 11.25% on Friday, defying government pressure to accelerate the pace of monetary easing to revive economic growth.】
